alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 7:29AM PST until March 10 at 1:30PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Fresno County in central California... * Until 130 PM PST Friday. * At 729 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
